intro: Crotalaria vitellina var. typica, commonly known as the yellow crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow, spurred flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its seeds are encased in a hard, oblong pod, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop for livestock.
